ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The seminar gave us a great look at new and emerging research in the field of EHS. I learned so much from seminar! It would have been nice to see a few more professionals in the field working rather than all researchers, but both are valuable of course.
I think that there should be a larger variety of people that come in for seminar. It should not be solely people in academia, but people working in environmental health as well.

Once again, the range and expertise of the speakers brought in was enjoyable and interesting. The room we're eating and presenting in now is good, though it seems rude to make the class after us wait week after week to get started on time.

I enjoy EHS seminar greatly. I really appreciate the opportunity to hear from a variety of speakers in EHS to learn about the variety of topics in our department. However, Journal Club could have better structure.
A diverse and interesting selection of speakers.
The seminars were more likely to be focusing on toxicology or molecular biology, which is not the main interest for a M.P.H. student. Some topics are not suitable for EHS students.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr. Deziel did a great job organizing the seminar. Dr. Chen on the other hand is not a great journal club leader. She is a bit condescending in her responses to questions by students.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  she organizes the seminars very well.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  planning and organization of course well

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I always try to get my friends to come to the seminar, but there seems to be some hesitation most of the time. Might be the lack of advertising?
Seminars every other week covering a variety of environmental health topics
